bug.author: Anderssorby
bug.summary: Failed to create cloudendpoint/SSL-certificates for GCP
bug.description:
/kind bug What steps did you take and what happened: [A clear and concise description of what the bug is.] I created a config by running <denchmark-code>export CONFIG_URI="https://raw.githubusercontent.com/kubeflow/manifests/v0.7-branch/kfdef/kfctl_gcp_iap.0.7.1.yaml" kfctl build -V -f $CONFIG_URI </denchmark-code>
and then <denchmark-code>kfctl apply -V -f $CONFIG_FILE </denchmark-code>
What did you expect to happen: After that I try to connect to the kubeflow UI at https://${KF_NAME}.endpoints.${PROJECT}.cloud.goog, which gives a DNS_PROBE_FINISHED_NXDOMAIN. The endpoint was not created apparently. Running gcloud beta compute ssl-certificates list returns: <denchmark-code>NAME TYPE CREATION_TIMESTAMP EXPIRE_TIME MANAGED_STATUS mcrt-1a24771e-ae37-*** MANAGED 2020-01-17T04:00:31.417-08:00 PROVISIONING ***.endpoints.***.cloud.goog: FAILED_NOT_VISIBLE </denchmark-code>
So I suspect the issue has something to do with the ssl-certificate Anything else you would like to add: [Miscellaneous information that will assist in solving the issue.] Trying to follow this guide: <denchmark-link:https://www.kubeflow.org/docs/gke/troubleshooting-gke/>https://www.kubeflow.org/docs/gke/troubleshooting-gke/</denchmark-link>
<denchmark-code>kubectl describe -n istio-system managedcertificate gke-certificate Name: gke-certificate Namespace: istio-system Labels: app.kubernetes.io/component=iap-ingress app.kubernetes.io/instance=iap-ingress-v0.7.1 app.kubernetes.io/managed-by=kfctl app.kubernetes.io/name=iap-ingress app.kubernetes.io/part-of=kubeflow app.kubernetes.io/version=v0.7.1 kustomize.component=iap-ingress Annotations: kubectl.kubernetes.io/last-applied-configuration: {"apiVersion":"networking.gke.io/v1beta1","kind":"ManagedCertificate","metadata":{"annotations":{},"labels":{"app.kubernetes.io/component"... API Version: networking.gke.io/v1beta1 Kind: ManagedCertificate Metadata: Creation Timestamp: 2020-01-17T12:00:29Z Generation: 3 Resource Version: 19712 Self Link: /apis/networking.gke.io/v1beta1/namespaces/istio-system/managedcertificates/gke-certificate UID: f4c49875-3920-11ea-a045-**** Spec: Domains: ***.endpoints.***.cloud.goog Status: Certificate Name: mcrt-1a24771e-ae37-**** Certificate Status: Provisioning Domain Status: Domain: ***.endpoints.***.cloud.goog Status: FailedNotVisible Events: <none> </denchmark-code>
Environment:
Kubeflow version: (version number can be found at the bottom left corner of the Kubeflow dashboard): kfctl version: (use kfctl version): kfctl v1.0-rc.1-8-g1098878 Kubernetes platform: (e.g. minikube): GKE Kubernetes version: (use kubectl version): v1.14.10 OS (e.g. from /etc/os-release): Arch Linux

comments.comment:

ðŸ˜… Problem solved; I had not enabled the Service Management API. The annoying thing was that there was no error message to indicate that that was the issue. Maybe add this as a troubleshooting step or something. This was a big head ache hope it helps someone.
